2018-09-18.text: Fuck, starting to tackle POCD manifestations... fuck this! So hard, but I’ve got this 💪 #ERP

2018-09-14.text: Whoa, I needed to hear this today! I’m feeling a lot of frustration and sadness due to my parents dismissal of how seriously out of control my OCD is... they reassure and accommodate automatically, and I’m exhausted telling them to stop; they just don’t get it 🤦‍♂️ https://t.co/N4o55tJaid

ERP is so brutal, but so amazing... I’m all in even though it’s painful and I can feel the progress! I am always filled with violent and sexual intrusive thoughts, but I’m getting a handle, and now learning how differentiate between my corrosive automatic thoughts and fight back!

2018-09-09.text: All the time, specially after doing exposures.

I’ve been absent from twitter for a bit... so exhausted and so overwhelmed. I just finished my first week of partial hospitalization ERP and it makes me so hopeful! I wish there was a word for excited and terrified, that’s what I am. Anyways, I got this 💪 hardest thing ever!

2018-09-04.text: Today is the day I start my Intensive Outpatient ERP; fucking terrified and all I want to do is run, but I won’t 💪 fuck you OCD you are not my master!

2018-08-25.text:
Yes, that sounds like OCD to me; I do that and catch myself

O - stress from an obsession can cause symptoms of what your obsessing about (e.g. fear of heart attack can cause palpitations)

C - reassurance seeking (classic); rumination, research, asking others, etc.

Make sense?

2018-08-24.text: Thank you so much; one foot in front of the other.

2018-08-23.text: I feel like as my awareness of my #OCD grows it continues to shift on me to further frustrate and confuse me; also, not gonna lie, having Relationship-OCD while trying to work through my wife’s betrayal is fucking awful doing exposures.

2018-08-20.text: My ERP is going well, and I’m so scared of starting my Intensive Outpatient Program in September; I can feel my OCD going into overdrive trying to convince me not to do it (its death throes if you will), but I’m trudging forward; they combine ERP with ACT which I’m excited for 💪

2018-08-19.text: I dunno, it’s kind of overwhelming, like thinking about all the time wasted; I’m almost more angry at the “non-violent” intrusive thoughts because they are so sneaky; the “violent” intrusive thoughts are obvious. Fuck, this is so hard and frustrating, but I got this (2/2) 💪 #OCD

I am gaining so much awareness about my OCD that I realize how many intrusive thoughts are “good” that I’ve done for years, but they still bring me anxiety and dread even though they are pleasurable; if that makes sense? It’s about how the thought occurs and not the content (1/2)

I understand it’s hard on spouses; I wish my wife was as supportive of me as you are you your significant other. It is hard, and I’m sorry for your struggles and your wife’s struggles... that being said, thank you for her sake 👏
I hear you; you got this 💪

2018-08-17.text: I just found out that I’ve been accepted into an “Intensive ERP Program”... I am scared shitless! I feel like I’m about to lose everything! I feel crazy, I feel like my OCD is a lie, I feel like my pride is shattered, I feel embarrassed, I feel anger; but I won’t give up! 💪 #OCD

Here I am, just sitting through my anxiety... I hate when my intrusive thoughts aren’t awful b/c they’re less obvious, but just as disruptive; I hate it because a lot of good has come from them, but a ton of time’s been wasted and it’s fed the beast. No intrusive thought is good.

Great read and some very insightful musings from a creative who also had OCD (very similar to me); I will say, that I find it intriguing there are so many creatives in the OCD community... anyways, well worth the time to read; awesome stuff!

 https://t.co/UFJMjamEhj
I compulsively demolish my mosquito bites; I just rip my skin to shreds... OCD sucks. I’ll be in the shower the next day and be like “damnit OCD you got me again”

Wow, this is a great article! Though I have been misdiagnosed for years, my OCD was relatively manageable, but completely exploded after the birth of my 1st child and then reached a true crisis point after the birth of my 2nd child; bravo, thank you for sharing your story! #OCD https://t.co/aDadbjXUGE
Thank you, I appreciate it; I am intrigued.
Whoa, curious to know what meds you’re on?
🙋‍♂️ I often avoid going to bed because how hard it is; I dread it... I work myself to exhaustion or do something compulsion until I’m ready to crash. It sucks, I feel ya.
Thanks, Colin; hoping the best for you... be well 💪 https://t.co/E60EuCy5r9

Yeah, I feel like it’s OCD’s defense mechanism to be like “no you’re faking this”... I definitely get that thought a bunch, and I always seem to catch it after about of serious reassurance seeking or rationalizing.

I totally have compulsions, I have very serious paralysis like anyone else with severe OCD, but I am (more or less) a “non visual ritualizer”... Moreover, I know people with “contamination” OCD that tend to have minor themes in other categories, and I think “Pure O” is like that.
Anyways, good article for sure, and I don’t thing anyone is necessarily “pure” anything with regards to OCD, it’s all OCD... and no two cases are identical.

For me, someone who suffers from “Pure O” I find it comforting because I don’t feel alone; I was misdiagnosed for years because I am a “non visual ritualizer”; any of my visual compulsions are minor or come off as quirky, but the shit that goes on in my head is down right magic!

2018-08-16.text: Well, it’s no fun either way; we all got to stick together hahaha

Yes, yes, yes! I feel like a burden when I talk to those who don’t understand and it absolutely makes me feel worse... like “no, I would not choose to be this way and it sucks, sorry to inconvenience you”... group is amazing and online has been pretty amazing for me.

That’s a really good point, thanks! There is comfort in being grounded irrespective of whatever comfort or discomfort I’m feeling... I suppose that’s being mindful and living in the present; radical acceptance is hard though.

Ugh, good to know I’m not alone; it’s so hard! The thoughts about how I’m affecting others or the perceived thoughts about how I’m affecting others is crippling and spikes my paranoia and reassurance seeking... that’s when I really know it’s OCD.
Happens to me all the time; I think the words or phrases are more distressing than the images... like they seem more real, or deadly, or scary.

I feel like a burden to everyone... do other people with #OCD ever feel this way? It cycles to a lot of hateful intrusive thoughts towards myself which turns in to a lot of self hate... like worthlessness, and loathsomeness, and loneliness. Is this common? Anyone else feel this?
Well said, the magic thought of “it not feeling correct” is really hard to explain... I have that too and it is very frustrating!

Today is a good day; a really good day! But I’m not equipped well for these yet because it makes my #OCD spin and say “see you’re okay, you don’t need help, your stress has passed, it’s all in your head”... yada yada yada; not today OCD, you are sneaky, but I’m on to you! 🤦‍♂️

2018-08-15.text: Got off the phone with a long IOP phone call today to help setup intensive #ERP and I should hear back from the doctor’s with a plan in the next 2 days; they said I was a great candidate for starting immediately, so that’s promising... also terrifying! I’m gonna take down #OCD 💪

Anyone with Pure-O or Harm-OCD or #OCD read the book “American Psycho”??? I read this book years ago and realized how similar it was to me; tried to explain to everyone that it was all in his head and that he didn’t do anything... everyone looked at me like I was crazy. Thoughts?

Her mother and father are on my side, and no previous gf has said that, I never have been emotionally abusive, but the doubt she plants makes me question everything; now I’m going through and talking to my ex’s to seek reassurance, and low-and-behold I’m not a shitty person (2/2)

Well, because of my wife’s #betrayal and my #OCD, my reassurance seeking has reached an all new complicated level... ironically, I reached out to one of my ex’s because my wife seems to be gaslighting me and calling me “emotionally absuive” which is a serious accusation... (1/2)

Gotcha! Not that it’s been any easier for me in the US, just different... I spent the last 4 years getting misdiagnosed and thrown around to different people before I landed. I wish you all the best ❤️
Yowza that’s a long time to wait... is that a UK thing? Sorry if I sound ignorant. Congrats though, and I wish you the best!

Thank you for sharing, and thank you for your encouragement and reaching out!

You have helped me today, thank you!

As I’ve said before, this corner of Twitter is very refreshing, and supportive and I am so thankful.

Cheers, mate!

2018-08-14.text: Thank you, that means a lot; this community on Twitter is inspiring!

I replied “it’s okay to not be okay, and I AM NOT OKAY”... too little to late with her compassion, both my parents and her parents reached out and understand; apparently our marriage is all my OCD’s fault and not the fault of her betraying me. I didn’t choose this, she did! (3/4)

Can you think of two worse things to say to someone in distress? She told me how she was worried about me, as if there was nothing to worry about before? I told her that those are terrible things to say; she said “well, you need to be better and do better, this is not okay” (2/3)

Not gonna lie, today was one of the worst days of my life; my suicidal intrusive thoughts were so crippling combined with my wife’s betrayal, that I could not get out of bed and had to call out of work... my wife told me to “suck it up” and “don’t let the kids hear you cry” (1/3)
Yeah, the attachment and search for meaning is really difficult to not do... I feel ya 🤦‍♂️
Very well put; if I think it might be OCD it is OCD... my awareness with its shiftiness is growing as I go through ERP, but damn is it clever!
I do the same, and lately I have very lucid dreams in the morning that feel like they are real, but they are just false memories; so confounding and frustrating... always exhausting!
Okay, thanks, it’s a new one for me and I assumed, but wow what a doozy! I fucking hate #OCD and how it is so shifty. Gonna keep fighting 💪

I don’t know you, but I hear you; I hope you read this and that this isn’t goodbye... there is always hope, and I hope for you; your pain is undoubtably real (the 1st arrow), but don’t fire that 2nd arrow and find the meaning in your suffering... please, f;ght 💪❤️🤘

Does anyone else struggle with the thought that “I must be making all of this up” or “it’s really not that bad, you’re lying to yourself and everyone else” ??? That’s #OCD right?! Like this is a twisted confounding intrusive thought?!
I am thankful for my Mother; she has been the most thankful support through my struggle with #OCD always understanding, fearless, compassionate, and loving; I am very lucky ❤️

2018-08-13.text: Ugh, people suck; you are heard here... best wishes ❤️

I hate the word “triggered” and I never thought I would have “triggers”... but damn do I HAVE TRIGGERS! It’s like I can’t keep track of them and I know I need to work more on my anticipation and acceptance, but when I get triggered it’s like a death spiral! Fuck #OCD

Self harm intrusive thoughts are so distressing and very confusing when you’re feeling worthless and feel the jaws of depression clamping down. Reaching out for the help I need, but I’m feeling lost and in a lot of pain.
Thoughts? I think this will help my #OCD I don’t do much, but I figure it can’t hurt! (2/2)

I think I might cut coffee, sugar, and alcohol out of my life for a while; maybe I’ll do a step down going into September: 1 cup of coffee only, no more than 4 beers on the weekend only whether it’s one day or over a few, and no sugary drinks; then come September nothing (1/2)

Doing better but today has been hard; I know some of it is anxiety regarding if I’ll get into the intensive #ERP program on Wednesday or not. I want to do it but I hope they take me, I hope there isn’t a waiting list, I hope they don’t commit me; suicidal intrusive thoughts suck!
Thank you ❤️
Sucks 🙁

It is so brutal, and it’s so hard because we have children, and I’m trying to just keep it all together and be responsible and deal with my OCD... I’m doing all the right things and life still punches me in the gut! Thanks for your words, and you’re probably right; ugh.
That’s me today too
In this moment I am losing it... because of my emotions with being betrayed, and the dread of once they subside my intrusive thoughts flooding my brain; fuck.

Working through #betrayal is fucking hard... I hate myself so much! Why me? What did I do? If only this; if only that... when in reality, she made a choice irrespective of me and that is the painful truth. I feel worthless and emasculated, and I don’t know how to cope or recover.

Work has proved to be a healthy distraction today, and my intrusive thoughts aren’t present (for now); even during lulls. Unfortunately, this makes me doubt my efforts at home and the dread of going home is very real... #betrayal is hard, but I will work at it, #OCD is hard too!
Best wishes!
“What if” is the bane of all OCD sufferers... we know nothing for certain, and it is brutal!
Today is one of those days where I can’t wait to get back home and go right to bed 🙁
There is hope; always. https://t.co/3ifTUWbLcM
Hahaha, yep, me too; exactly!

I am a wealthy man because of my children, I am a broken man because of my wife’s #betrayal, I am a strong man because of my struggle with #OCD and #depression, I am a brave man because I endure/persist, I am a happy man because of my potential, I am a sad man because of my dread

That’s what my wife said when I was diagnosed with OCD... she called me crazy and a danger, then she left me to have an affair leaving me alone with my kids. If I’m such a danger why leave me alone with your kids?! I’m not crazy nor a danger! I’m sick! People project their fears.

I hear you and understand you; I think the most important part of ERP is (1) someone who knows what they’re doing (2) the combination with ACT “Acceptance and Commitment Therapy” (3) and genuine support. Anyways, it’s scary and hard, but when done correctly it’s very beneficial.

You’re welcome, thank you for writing this; I’m working on putting mine into words and it’s part of my ERP which is difficult. I appreciate what you wrote and completely understand; the invisible battle is very really, very isolating, and very hard to convey. Keep up the fight 💪

2018-08-12.text: This is so well written and such a good read! Bravo! My wife said the other day “the struggle is all in your head, but good news, the struggle is all in your head” I about lost it; it’s so frustrating and so isolating and such an uniformed narrow opinion. Thanks for writing this! https://t.co/2LphvxbtQB
Thanks for sharing; this inspires me!
I’m right there with you; you’re not alone in your struggle 💪 it’s hard, and I hear you and understand you.
Sorry to hear, I’m right there with you, at least you’re not alone in that sense.

I don’t get a break from being betrayed or OCD or being a parent, but sure dear you’re tired you take a nap if only I was afforded the same opportunity after I work... whatever, at least I get to enjoy the extra time with my daughters and dogs in a clean house 💪 I got this!

So, I’m pretty sure my wife is a trigger; she comes home and I’m in a worse mood. Recovering from #betrayal is fucking difficult, and having #OCD on top of that only makes it harder; love is complicated! My daughters are my everything and we’re in counseling, but damn this sucks!
You got this 💪 even if anxiety strikes you’ll be okay; I believe in you... enjoy your time with your family and the outdoors!

This corner of Twitter is pretty special... cheers to all of you and your hard work with your mental health, your struggles, your support, your advocacy, your hardships, your battles... you’re all brave and unique; together we got this 💪 you’re not alone, and here you’re heard!!
Totally, huge relief getting the correct diagnosis. Thanks!
...um, that’s really challenging for someone with #OCD and intrusive thoughts; like literally my biggest struggle, and it is distressing.

I was misdiagnosed for years (understandably I suppose) because of my horrendous suicidal and harm intrusive thoughts; thankfully, I’ve find the right help with the right diagnosis... it was a mind fuck to be called suicidal and a danger though I’m not, but my mind shows me loops

Currently, one of the hardest things for my “Pure O” is that I don’t know what my triggers are, except for maybe knives, but I can’t do self exposures well; I’m sure I’ll get better with my #ERP but I wish I could conjure it up; however, if I could control it I wouldn’t have #OCD

Yes, it is, I must make it more of a priority; I love walking and I love nature, but my OCD always reasons against me... I’m aware of its attempt now, and nature is basically magic... so yeah, I just need to do it more!
I need to do this more
I need to remember this!
That sounds nice; happy for you and the good emotions ❤️
Great pics! Thanks for the share! Hope it was emotional in a good way ☺️
As someone with Pure O, and a creative professional, this is a fantastic article; great post. Make yourself right; make yourself number one 💪 great work! https://t.co/85LK7qFRMf

Watching the original “Pete’s Dragon” with my eldest daughter while the other daughter sleeps... always wish I had an Elliot as a friend... think I might actually get a tattoo of Elliot someday; this Disney movie always makes me feel good. What movie(s) make you feel good? https://t.co/B5s9IKLLLd

Anyone ever try the 4;7;8 breathing strategy? It’s worked for me and hasn’t turned into a compulsion... I think, for me at least, it works because it doesn’t reduce my anxiety/distress, but slows my heart rate down and allows me to refocus and endure. #mindfulness #breathing #OCD
That’s still 10% vertical which is better than 0% vertical 💪

...everyday they inspire me to be the best I can be, and their happiness is a gift to the world that I never want to be part of extinguishing! They give me courage, hope, and strength! I wake with them every morning, put them to bed every night, and they always ask for me first!

My daughters are my main inspiration! When my wife left me and them, some how, I was able to maintain normalcy until my wife realized she messed up and decided to try and work on it; our support system was impressive, but nothing compared to the beautiful innocence’s of my girls.

I suppose I get some solace that as my wife’s family left they acknowledged the elephant in the room, cried and said they love and support me; they said “keep fighting” and they know they need to talk to their daughter; something is better than nothing. #Betrayal with #OCD sucks!
damn, that’s legit; I wish too
My frustration everyday!
This is painfully accurate; great share!
greater capacity for compassion and empathy; you experience a great depth/breadth of life

...oh well, I got this 💪 I just want everyone out of my house so I can normal out! this is all way too soon and I wasn’t ready for it, but it has happened and I’m in it. Only a few more hours, then I can refocus and normal out. Hard to do exposures when you don’t have support!

...yes I’m gonna take care of everything and yes everything is gonna be clean, but I am distressed-the-fuck-out! It’s hard enough dealing with ocd, let alone being a parent, let alone trying to recover from betrayal; I suppose it’s easier for people to try to ignore the elephant!

...I dunno, it’s like a respect thing; like, leave shit better than you found it and everyone knows that I’ve been betrayed and I have serious OCD, but nope I suffer in silence therefor I’m okay; some people are just inconsiderate and it’s frustrating...

My wife left for work, but left way early because she neglected to write her schedule correctly, her parents and uncle are still here (extra awkward after her affair), they’re gonna leave the place a mess, I’ve got our daughters by myself; my #OCD has me close to a panic...
You’re welcome ❤️💪

I’m sorry to hear that; that quote is unfortunate; it’s like it’s trying to talk about “dukkha” but completely butchering it. The story of the second-arrow: pain is real and isn’t a choice, but we get to choose our level of suffering... the second-arrow is suffering; stay strong!
Well said, I needed to be reminded of this today; thank you!

Hope you all have the best day you can, and that you hold on to the good moments more than the bad; may you all find acceptance in yourself and be able to better live in the present. Struggling with mental health is hard, but it is not impossible 💪 we all got this! #inspiration

False memories are new to me, and are a bizarre/uncomfortable type of intrusive thought; I hate how #OCD shifts/reinvents itself, but at least I’m aware of its attempts (even if they are distressing). They seem to happen to me most after sleep and are sometimes like lucid dreams.
💪 Proud of you! This inspires me! Keep it up! 💪
Woa, really well said.
You got this 💪🤘
me too; ocd is the worst! good exposure 💪 fight good fight and keep standing up to ocd!
Agreed!

My dog helps me ALL THE TIME... only creature that I think can read my mind and doesn’t judge me and lets me know it’s all okay. Animals are amazing! I have intrusive thoughts about her sometimes, but it washes away when I see her.

Last thought (I think before I try to sleep, because I know I’m gonna be up early with my daughters): I wish that I could trade my brain/thoughts/emotions for a day with those who don’t “get it”, not for my own reprieve, but for their education, empathy and understanding. #OCD 💪
It’s the worst, right!? Like fuel on a fire!

...they still ALWAYS say “calm down” like I haven’t told them to not say those words a shit ton of times, and then they’re surprised when I can’t calm down or something; I wish people would listen better and/or more sometimes.

...sorry for the language! Venting because I feel like I’m talking to a wall with my loved ones sometimes when trying to explain; like, I tell them the least they can do for me is to never say the words “calm down” if I’m having a panic attack; for me, it’s better to say nothing.

Fuck, I hate when I’m having a panic attack, and people say “it’s okay” or “calm down”... no, stop saying those phrases! Maybe learn some excercises to help ground me the fuck down, because those words just make shit worse; clearly angry and frustrated now. MH/OCD education woes!

I hear you, understand you and relate; probably one of the most hard things to talk about related to an OCD theme, we talked about it in group this last week and it is still very hard; the therapist was a complete pro about it, thankfully.  has some great stuff btw!

Do others have a hard time when people don’t follow through with what they say? Like simple shit, like yes the door is unlocked and then isn’t, or yes I let them know “x”, but didn’t... that behavior is like a tidal wave trigger to me and sends me in full blown panic!

2018-08-11.text: ...no reassurance please, just had to get it out somewhere at least. I hope everyone is having a better moment than me; this too shall pass.

...now I’m home, my daughters are asleep, and my room is dark and I’m just trying to get the images out of head like I still did it or something... like “hit-and-run-ocd” or something, I want to text the people at the party to check, but I won’t; this is the worst, so exhausting!

...ugh, then it seems like my ruminations to control the awful obsessions became another obsession, and the loop is brutal! #OCD seems to attack that which you care about the most! I am aware of what some of the triggers were today, but they bested me; at least no one could tell.

I have a hard time leaving parties/get-togethers; when it comes time to leave my violent intrusive thoughts flood my brain! I was just at a family ruinion and my brain was flooded with a bloodbath; I hate it! My brain is fried while keeping my pleasant demeanor and no one knows.
“That’s Life” sung by Frank Sinatra
You’re very welcome.
Done ☺️
Same to you. This space, I am finding is very special; community is important.
You’re very welcome, thank you!
Same.
Truth! This is very well said! https://t.co/vG5tiGqQ6h
Yeah, mine too... pretty sure everyone would run to the hills or I would be put in a straight jacket or something.
Be well, and good for you seeking the help you need; there is a community here and you’re not alone 💪
Yikes, me too, that sounds like a nightmare!
I’m going to go play my guitar now; screw it, I’m in control... starting my day off the way I want to start it!

I hate when my ruminating and rationalizing consume me; last night I was trapped by analysis paralysis; I couldn’t bring myself to do what I love; I couldn’t write music, I couldn’t play my guitar, I was frozen; I will try again today, and I accept what was yesterday; not today!!
This is my everything! Music is my solace... great post!

Finding good mental health help is so hard and frustrating; I completely feel for you and I’m sorry to hear that. I was misdiagnosed for 20 years, and it is frustrating to not be heard. I hear you, we hear you, here you are heard.

Dealing with an affair is hard enough, but with #OCD it’s even more challenging. Love will prevail and the truth will set you free, but now I have a whole new host of intrusive thoughts that are unbearable. I choose to hold on to hope and to give love a chance, always!

Good morning all! Hope everyone is doing the best they can... night time / bed time / morning is so hard for me... I hate waking up to intrusive thoughts everyday, and most of the time my dreams are lucid and it all seems extremely real which is extra distressing and exhausting.

2018-08-10.text: Thanks, I see that already; it’s something special among us all.

Working through my wife’s betrayal after my #OCD diagnosis for the sake of my daughters (she had a 3 month affair)... this weekend, her parents are visiting for the first time and it is brutal... my intrusive thoughts are flooding right now; I got this 💪 #ERP #RadicalAcceptance
Thank you, one step at a time; the community is a blessing with regards to all mental health. I’ve been inspired by those who have gone before me in my OCD group.
Cyber bullies are cowards, all bullies are, but cyber bullies are a special low... sorry you had to start your day that way, keep fighting the good fight.

This devil whispers in my ear
And every time it appears
I try to stop the thoughts I hear
But every time it grows my fears
Consumed with images so clear
Of grisly scenes, blood and tears
Reason can’t make it disappear
Becoming worse through the years
Hope once far, now seems near

Thanks, it’s not easy, but I’m happy to finally have a diagnosis and direction... I have my daughters to fight and live for, and my own life. Thankful to part of this community; group has helped so much.

Keep up the good fight; good to hear about your therapy! My day has been up-and-down... starting the process of doing an intensive ERP at Rogers and having anxiety waiting about what’s gonna happen, but I can’t do anything about it except for being honest, working and waiting.

I’ve definitely been dangerously depressed; I’m surprised I’m not trapped in its jaws now; my #OCD wants to convince me I am; however, the SSRI I’m on and the medical team around me is incredible and I trust them; trust is one of the hardest with OCD. Anyone else feel that way?

...follow up, it’s hard when you have suicidal-ocd, it’s really “intrusive-self-harm-thoughts-and-imagines-which-cause-distress-doubt-and-concern-ocd” buuuuut that’s kind of a mouthful... one step at a time, yes to #RadicalAcceptance

This is my first time going through #ERP; it is painful and inspiring all wrapped up into one fun #OCD ball; last night’s session was really tough, but I see my awareness growing, which is a good start. I hate the stigma around #suicide, it caused me to be misdiagnosed for years!
I completely agree with all of this, ugh!

OCD is the tough, and I completely empathize and agree with you... I hate when people say something like “well, we all of a little bit of OCD”, or “yeah, I’m a little bit OCD”...  no, you idiots, you don’t get it. Hang in there!
This is a very awesome infographic and a very important discussion; thanks for sharing this!

#OCD is tough on relationships... with romantic and professional relationships you face stigma and fear which only can compound your own fears. Paranoia and doubt are my destroyers... no, I can’t just stop, if I could I would; I work on it everyday, it is a lifelong process!

My OCD is worse before sleep and when I wake up, it’s like when my mind starts shutting down a flood of intrusive thoughts come; I normally work myself to exhaustion to avoid the thoughts, but eventually it catches up to me... so, yes, it is worse when my sleep is worse.

Story 001: I have a frightening thought of jumping to death from the Ben Franklin; in an attempt to do a self guided exposure, I decided to traverse the bridge. This was good, and I faced my fear, but it was an elaborate rationalization instead of an exposure. OCD is tricky. #OCD

Everyday I am inundated with brutal self-harm intrusive thoughts; no, I am not suicidal, I have OCD... I am not depressed, I am distressed! OCD is extremely misunderstood, and I’d like to help shed light on it! #OCD
